articles.description: The Culling is getting released again on the Xbox One. This time, the game includes better graphics, better AI and a shockingly bad monetisation system that only allows you to play online once per day.
articles.content: The battle royale title, The Culling, is once again returning to Xbox One, this time with several changes, including better graphics, better AI and possibly one of the most punishing monetisation models ever seen. The Culling: Origins will cost $5.99, however… [+1856 chars]

articles.author: Wesley Yin-Poole
articles.title: In Mortal Kombat 11, RoboCop enlists the help of ED-209 - Eurogamer.net
articles.content:
NetherRealm has offered us a good look at Mortal Kombat 11: Aftermath gameplay, including new DLC character RoboCop.
The video shows one of RoboCop's fatalities, which calls in that good doggy robot ED-209 for some twin mini-gun action. Meanwhile, RoboCop, w… [+1408 chars]

articles.title: Here's The New 300bhp VW Golf GTI Clubsport Looking Sharp At The 'Ring - Car Throttle
articles.description: The more focused version of the Golf 8 GTI has been spotted undergoing testing at the Nurburgring
articles.content:
The Golf 8 GTI hasnt even been launched yet, and VW is already working on a hotter version. Thats the kind of keenness we can get on board with. 
A prototype GTI Clubsport - successor to the TCR -has been spotted hammering around the Nurburgring Nordschleife… [+1645 chars]

articles.title: New Animal Crossing: New Horizons Glitch Lets You Walk On Rooftops And In The Sea - Nintendo Life
articles.description: Quirky photo op, anyone?
articles.content: Animal Crossing: New Horizons glitches seem to be coming in thick and fast these days. In recent times, we've seen a couple of item duplication glitches, one that could bug plots of land, and even one that prevented balloons from appearing. Now, we have yet a… [+1073 chars]

articles.author: Shaun Nichols
articles.title: Sadly, 111 in this story isn't binary. It's decimal. It's the number of security fixes emitted by Microsoft this week - The Register
articles.description: Nothing too scary. Plus updates from SAP, Adobe, VMware
articles.content:
The May edition of Patch Tuesday landed this week. And there are scores of security fixes to install.
A total of 111 fixes were released by Microsoft, though on the bright side none are being actively exploited, as far as we know. Sixteen earned Microsoft's … [+3253 chars]
